description.narrative: 1. Increasing SME access to finance: SME access to finance in Indonesia is relatively low, with a penetration level of 30% of total SMEs, and with 65% of SMEs still needing additional lending. Hana Indonesia plans to address this gap as it rolls out its expansion plan, by opening more SME branches and networks from 2013 to 2015. This increase in SME lending will also ultimately drive economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction. 2. Promoting South-South investment: Partnering and supporting a reputable regional bank such as Hana Korea in its expansion in Indonesia where IFC has a strong on-the-ground regional advisory team and Indonesia investment team.

The proposed investment is part of an IFC effort to support PT. Bank Hana (Hana Indonesia or the Bank), an existing IFC client, to increase its capacity to lend to small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The proposed project will allow Hana Indonesia to expand the volume and maturity of its SME loan portfolio. The proposed project is also consistent with both IFCs Indonesia and financial markets strategy given that this project will help provide more access to finance for SMEs, promote job creation, and sustainable urbanization.

mailing-address.narrative: Lee, Hwa-Soo (Director and CFO) Wisma Mulia 52nd floor Jl. Jend. Gatot Subroto No. 42 Jakarta, 12710 INDONESIA Phone: (62-21) 522 0222, 522 0223 Fax: (62-21) 522 0133 http://www.hanabank.co.id

name.narrative: Hana Indonesia is headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia and operates over 30 branches with ATMs connected to the biggest network provider in Indonesia. Hana is a midsize bank in Indonesia and currently employs around 400 people. The proposed investment will support the Banks growth strategy and increase its reach in the fast-growing Indonesia banking system. The Bank will be able to leverage its equity to expand the volume and maturity of its SME loan portfolio.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
